pr_title: PLANNER-2145: Remove workaround in flight example solver manager

timeline.message:
PLANNER-2145: Remove workaround in flight example solver manager

Also fixed errors that were introduced from changes to the tasks
api.

timeline.bodyText:
If an error occurs, does the user somehow get told in the UI that it did? (and kind of of error it was?)
Or does the error get swept under the carpet?
timeline.author: ge0ffrey

replies.bodyText: In this case, we would need to save the exception somewhere as this exception will happen AFTER the REST call returns (so even if we did throw it, the REST call have no way of knowing). The flight will disappear from the UI. So we would need to poll a new REST endpoint for errors.
replies.author: Christopher-Chianelli

replies.bodyText: (for errors thrown during REST call invocation, those are shown in the UI already; for an error that occurs in this place, no exception is shown in the UI as it isn't thrown + it requires a new REST endpoint to work (or does Kogito generate an process aborted REST endpoint?)
replies.author: Christopher-Chianelli
